text: - 3M had thousands

of applications that we had
to migrate to the cloud.

We needed to do that to
exit our aging data center.
We had risks that we wanted to mitigate.

3M has a very wide and
diverse set of workloads,

and AWS Application Migration
service really provided

the key ingredients to allow
us to migrate our workloads.

We were able to do thousands
of applications over 24 months,

and do that in a way that
was consistent, reliable,
minimizing our business downtime,
and also, all at the same time,

continue to grow and
deploy new technology.
We were able to move our ERP workloads
or some of our most critical workloads
to the cloud.
That allowed us to scale up

and meet demand that previously
would take many, many months

for us to align to with
our on-prem data centers.
Many of the opportunities that 3M has seen

through the application
migration, we've moved

and migrated workloads into,
for instance, RDS Services.

We've implemented many
Lambda capabilities,

and that's really
advanced us to technology

and a footprint that we
want to continue to develop

from an application/modernization
perspective.

We've entered into multiple
regions within AWS,

bringing our compute not
only closer to our customers,

but also allowing us
the capability to scale
and drive new technologies closer
to where our customer base is.
